post.summary: Browse the taxonomy of audience categories

post.description:
Deletes an existing targeting audience based on audience ID. Only available for the audiences of the type: *PRODUCT_PURCHASES*, *PRODUCT_VIEWS*, *PRODUCT_SIMS*, *PRODUCT_SEARCH* and *COMBINED_AUDIENCE*

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["advertiser_campaign_edit"]

parameters.description: ID that describe DSP advertiser level accounts that exists under a manager account (previously under a DSP entity). The owner of the audience.
parameters.name: AdvertiserId

schema.description: ID that describe DSP advertiser level accounts that exists under a manager account (previously under a DSP entity). The owner of the audience.

put.description:
Updates an existing targeting audience based on an audience definition and audience ID.

**Requires one of these permissions**:
["advertiser_campaign_edit"]

parameters.description: ID that describe DSP advertiser level accounts that exists under a manager account (previously under a DSP entity). The owner of the audience.
parameters.name: AdvertiserId

schema.description: ID that describe DSP advertiser level accounts that exists under a manager account (previously under a DSP entity). The owner of the audience.

audienceId.description: Identifier of audience for which edit was attempted.

idempotencyKey.description: unique request token for this request.

index.description: Index of the DspAudienceEditRequestItem from the request. e.g. 1st item in the request will correspond to index 0 in the response.

message.description: A human-readable description of the response.

ListAudiencesRequestBodyV1.description: Resulting segments will match all specified filters

countries.description: The ISO Alpha-2 country codes to search audiences from. This field must be specified if the advertiser does not have an associated country. Currently, it is only supported to specify a single country per request.

message.description: A human-readable description of the response.

requestId.description: A value created by Amazon API Gateway that uniquely identifies your request.

lowerBoundInclusive.description: The inclusive lower bound for the bucket.  If not specified, the bucket captures all values below the upper bound.

upperBoundExclusive.description: The exclusive upper bound for the bucket.  If not specified, the bucket captures all values above the lower bound.

dailyImpressions.description: The forecasted available daily impressions for the inventory type.

dailyReach.description: The forecasted unique devices reachable daily for the inventory type.

AccessDeniedExceptionResponseContent.description: User does not have sufficient access to perform this action.

DspAudienceEditResponseContent.description: Holds an array of successful items and an array of error items from the request.

Operator.description: For a given attributeType, operator used for attributeValues.

Clause.description: parameter used to include or exclude this particular rule. Currently only include is supported.

FetchTaxonomyRequestBodyV1.description: The response data will have the categories that are under the given path, and main categories will be returned if no path is specified. The response data also depends on the adType specified here since ad programs may support targeting audiences in certain categories.

countries.description: The ISO Alpha-2 country codes to search audiences from. This field must be specified if the advertiser does not have an associated country. Currently, it is only supported to specify a single country per request.

InternalServerExceptionResponseContent.description: Unexpected error during processing of request.

AudienceDeleteInternalServerExceptionRes.description: Unexpected error during processing of request.

audienceId.description: The audience identifier of the audience to be actioned.

idempotencyKey.description: unique request token for this request.

index.description: index of the DspAudienceEditRequestItem from the request. e.g. 1st item in the request will correspond to index 0 in the response.

ResourceNotFoundExceptionResponseContent.description: Request references a resource which does not exist.

UnauthorizedExceptionResponseContent.description: Caller does not have permissions to edit specified audience.

dailyReach.description: The forecasted unique devices reachable daily for the inventory type.

AttributeType.description: For a given audienceType, the type of the attributes being supplied.

AudienceType.description:
Type of the audience which is being edited.
This type must match the current audience type associated with the audienceId.

DspAudienceDeleteResponse.description: Holds an array of successful items and an array of error items from the request.

audiences.description: Array of segments matching given filters sorted by create time, earliest first.

ThrottlingExceptionResponseContent.description: Request was denied due to request throttling.

audienceId.description: Identifier of audience for which delete was attempted.

httpStatusCode.description: HTTP Response Code for the request

index.description: Index of the DspAudienceDeleteRequestItem from the request. e.g. 1st item in the request will correspond to index 0 in the response.

message.description: A human-readable description of the response.

dspAudienceDeleteRequestItems.description: A list of audiences to be deleted

DspAudienceEditRequestItem.description: Partial audience model to be used for edit of the audience.

audienceId.description: The audience identifier of the audience to be actioned.

idempotencyKey.description: unique request token for this request.

lookback.description:
The specified time period (in days) to include those who performed the action in the audience.
Lookback Constraints Table: Provides available valid values of lookback allowed for given audienceType
| audienceType | lookback range |
|------------------------------|-------|
| PRODUCT_PURCHASES            | 1-365 |
| PRODUCT_VIEWS                |  1-90 |
| PRODUCT_SEARCH               |  1-90 |
| PRODUCT_SIMS                 |  1-90 |

rules.description: Set of rules to define an audience, these rules will be ORed.

dailyReach.description: The forecasted unique devices reachable daily for the inventory type.

DspAudienceDeleteResponseContent.description: Holds an array of successful items and an array of error items from the request.

audienceId.description: The audience identifier of the audience to be actioned.

idempotencyKey.description: unique request token for this request.

index.description: index of the DspAudienceEditRequestItem from the request. e.g. 1st item in the request will correspond to index 0 in the response.

field.description: Field to filter by. Supported enums are 'audienceName', 'category', 'categoryPath', 'audienceId' and 'status'. The 'audienceName' is a broad match filter but not an exact match. The 'category' enum returns all audiences under a high-level category, whereas the 'categoryPath' enum expects a path of nodes in the taxonomy tree and returns audiences attached directly to the node at the specified path.

operator.description: Operator to apply to the specified filter.

AudienceDeleteBadGatewayExceptionRespons.description: Unexpected error during processing of request.

AudienceDeleteThrottlingExceptionRespons.description: Request was denied due to request throttling.

fees.description: Fees that will apply to this segment. Not all segments have fees. Fees may differ depending on the supply type the segment is attached to. In this case, multiple fee objects will be present.

amount.description: Fee amount in base currency units, multiplied by scaling factor ('scale').

currency.description: Base currency, such as US Dollar.

impressionSupplyType.description: To which supply types this fee applies to. The fee may be different for different supply types.

scale.description: Scale of the amount relative to the base currency unit. For instance, if the scale is 1000, the currency is USD, and the amount is 500, the human-readable fee is $0.50.

providerId.description: The Data Management Platform provider identifier. Only applicable to Third party audience segments.

BadGatewayExceptionResponseContent.description: Unexpected error during processing of request.

AudienceDeleteAccessDeniedExceptionRespo.description: User does not have sufficient access to perform this action.

audienceId.description: The audience identifier of the audience to be actioned.

idempotencyKey.description: unique request token for this request.

DSPAudienceRule.description:
Rule to define an audience.

**Rule Constraints Table**: Provides available valid combinations of parameters allowed in DspAudienceRule
| audienceType | attributeType | attributeValues | max attribute values  |  max rules |
|------------------------------|------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------|---|
| PRODUCT_PURCHASES            |        ASIN      | product IDs (ASINs) e.g. B08V4T57R2                                                                 | 1000 | 1
| PRODUCT_VIEWS                |        ASIN      | product IDs (ASINs) e.g. B08V4T57R2                                                                 | 1000 | 1
| PRODUCT_SEARCH               |        ASIN      | product IDs (ASINs) e.g. B08V4T57R2                                                                 | 1000 | 1
| PRODUCT_SIMS                 |        ASIN      | product IDs (ASINs) e.g. B08V4T57R2                                                                 | 1000 | 1

attributeValues.description: For a given audienceType and attributeType combination, the attribute values being supplied.

AudienceDeleteUnauthorizedExceptionRespo.description: Caller does not have permissions to edit specified audience.

dspAudienceEditRequestItems.description: A list of audience edit objects containing fields to be overwritten. For each object, specify fields and their values to be modified.
